content.raw:
How about adding a script to `package.xml` so that we can call `npm run sdf_build`? I think this does it:

~~~
diff -r b00e1aa4fe48 package.json
--- a/package.json	Tue Sep 12 22:00:04 2017 +0200
+++ b/package.json	Tue Sep 12 13:16:19 2017 -0700
@@ -7,7 +7,8 @@
     "url": "#!/osrf/gzweb"
   },
   "scripts": {
-    "test": "./node_modules/karma/bin/karma start --singleRun"
+    "test": "./node_modules/karma/bin/karma start --singleRun",
+    "sdf_build": "cd gz3d/utils grunt sdf_build cd ../.."
   },
   "dependencies": {
     "websocket": "",
~~~

Eventually we should start using these scripts and retire `updateGZ3D.sh`
content.html:
How about adding a script to package.xml so that we can call npm run sdf_build? I think this does it:

diff -r b00e1aa4fe48 package.json
--- a/package.json  Tue Sep 12 22:00:04 2017 +0200
+++ b/package.json  Tue Sep 12 13:16:19 2017 -0700
@@ -7,7 +7,8 @@
     "url": "#!/osrf/gzweb"
   },
   "scripts": {
-    "test": "./node_modules/karma/bin/karma start --singleRun"
+    "test": "./node_modules/karma/bin/karma start --singleRun",
+    "sdf_build": "cd gz3d/utils grunt sdf_build cd ../.."
   },
   "dependencies": {
     "websocket": "",

Eventually we should start using these scripts and retire updateGZ3D.sh

I think it's a good first step to isolate the functionality from `gzsdfparser.js` which is needed into a separate file like you did, it helps us see what is common between the two use cases and what needs to be changed.

In the long run, we should avoid code duplication and improve the `GZ3D.SdfParser` API so that the same file can be used on both cases.
content.html:
I think it's a good first step to isolate the functionality from gzsdfparser.js which is needed into a separate file like you did, it helps us see what is common between the two use cases and what needs to be changed.

In the long run, we should avoid code duplication and improve the GZ3D.SdfParser API so that the same file can be used on both cases.

content.raw:
I was just trying out the material parser, and I wasn't able to parse a file. 

I was wondering what is the motivation for having it in a separate package, do we think this may be useful for other applications? The code seems to be quite gzweb-specific. Maybe we can just keep that within GzWeb.
content.html:
I was just trying out the material parser, and I wasn't able to parse a file.

I was wondering what is the motivation for having it in a separate package, do we think this may be useful for other applications? The code seems to be quite gzweb-specific. Maybe we can just keep that within GzWeb.

content.raw:
Yes almost all of the code is from the gzbridge, 

The motivation to have it in a separate was that we want to make the ```sdfviewer``` headless and reusable, so, e.g. I'm a user who want to try my model on the ```sdfviewer``` , since we don't parse materials right now in the ```sdfviewer``` -to make it headless-, I thought a separate package for users to parse their materials would be a suitable choice. 

This might not be the best idea, but it did the job and was fine for me.

About the file that is not being parsed, I believe if the package couldn't parse it ```gzweb``` is not supposed to be able to too, which file was it?
content.html:
Yes almost all of the code is from the gzbridge,

The motivation to have it in a separate was that we want to make the sdfviewer headless and reusable, so, e.g. I'm a user who want to try my model on the sdfviewer , since we don't parse materials right now in the sdfviewer -to make it headless-, I thought a separate package for users to parse their materials would be a suitable choice.

This might not be the best idea, but it did the job and was fine for me.

About the file that is not being parsed, I believe if the package couldn't parse it gzweb is not supposed to be able to too, which file was it?

content.raw: Ah thanks, understood the motivation. Even though it's not clear to me how we can have the SDF parser work only on the browser if it needs C++ code from gzbridge. I need to look closer at the code.
content.html: Ah thanks, understood the motivation. Even though it's not clear to me how we can have the SDF parser work only on the browser if it needs C++ code from gzbridge. I need to look closer at the code.

content.raw:
When a mesh has texture defined in the mesh file the colladaLoader fails to load it, since the colladaLoader is trying to load the image through that the URI in the mesh. We can add a small hack where we pass all the images that we loaded to the colladaloader and modify it so it doesn’t call the threejs texture loader and uses the images as we provide them instead [in case we are loading files not using URLs of course] .

In case this work around does sound nice, I would suggest we make it in a separate PR because PR 117 is getting a little too big and might get harder to review.

There is also the idea that we delay this work around until we replace the ColladaLoader with the new one [ 3 day ago threejs replaced the colladaLoader with the new one on the dev branch].

We can also require the users to provide the URLs of the assets to the sdfviewer and not load the files.

What do you guys think?
content.html:
When a mesh has texture defined in the mesh file the colladaLoader fails to load it, since the colladaLoader is trying to load the image through that the URI in the mesh. We can add a small hack where we pass all the images that we loaded to the colladaloader and modify it so it doesn’t call the threejs texture loader and uses the images as we provide them instead [in case we are loading files not using URLs of course] .

In case this work around does sound nice, I would suggest we make it in a separate PR because PR 117 is getting a little too big and might get harder to review.

There is also the idea that we delay this work around until we replace the ColladaLoader with the new one [ 3 day ago threejs replaced the colladaLoader with the new one on the dev branch].

We can also require the users to provide the URLs of the assets to the sdfviewer and not load the files.

What do you guys think?

content.raw:
If you guys would give me your opinion on that it would be really helpful :)

@iche033 @chapulina
content.html:
If you guys would give me your opinion on that it would be really helpful :)

@iche033 @chapulina

content.html: I'm leaning towards focusing on getting a version working without the textures first, and revisiting this later once we have the new collada loader.
